question_text: What is a key difference between a hybrid cloud and a community cloud?
answer_options: Hybrid cloud involves only public cloud providers
Community cloud is always hosted externally
Hybrid cloud blends public and private environments, while community cloud is jointly managed by similar organizations
Community cloud includes both internal and external users
correct_answer: Hybrid cloud blends public and private environments, while community cloud is jointly managed by similar organizations
explanation: Hybrid cloud focuses on infrastructure types, while community cloud focuses on shared use among trusted partners.
